8s6y6eF6aIz8kL9y.description:
Trigger Auldegrund is reduced to 60 or fewer Hit Points

Frequency once per day

Effect Auldegrund calls out, in Infernal, "Give me the strength to slay these foes in your name, almighty Alocer!" As he does so, his skin darkens to red, diabolic horns jut from his brow, a flaming lion-like mane appears around his head, burning wings burst from his shoulders, and his weapons ignite with black fire.

He immediately heals [[/r (3d6+7)[healing]]]{3d6+7 Hit Points}, gains a fly speed of 25 feet, and deals an additional @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage with his melee and ranged Strikes.

This is a risky gambit, though, for Alocer is not patient. At the end of each of Auldegrund's turns, he must attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:11|name:End Invoke Alocer] (the DC of this flat check increases by 1 each round). On a failure, Alocer grows disappointed that Auldegrund has not defeated his foes and the effects of Invoke Alocer end immediately. This deals [[/r {3d6+7}]]{3d6+7 damage} to Auldegrund, removes his fly speed and additional fire damage to weapon Strikes, and causes Auldegrund to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.
8s6y6eF6aIz8kL9y.name: Invoke Alocer

HISjG6rAbyiDviDC.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half-plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

NWeQmIwwe3qjz779.description:
Auldegrund takes time to line up a shot with his bow and smiles cruelly as he makes a ranged Strike with it.

If he hits, he deals 2d6 precision damage and 1d6 bleed damage. Even if he misses, he still deals [[/r 2d6]] damage from the glancing blow. Only on a critical miss does his cruel shot deal no damage.
NWeQmIwwe3qjz779.name: Cruel Shot

PpTCy5Q6rMHeb9Ku.description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain [[/r (2d8+5)[healing]]]{2d8+5 Hit Points}.

sGGmfBpBIdaarMTN.description: Key ring for every door in Lionlodge.
sGGmfBpBIdaarMTN.name: Lionlodge Key Ring

Bad Vibrations.description: The three larger crystals on the table begin to vibrate and emit a swiftly growing peal of sound.
Bad Vibrations.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:17] (trained) or @Check[type:occultism|dc:17] (trained) to disrupt the magic enchanting one of the crystals, or @Check[type:performance|dc:20] (trained) by a character who can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WILXkjU5Yq3yw10r]{Counter Performance} to use sound to redirect the noise back into the crystal, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd level, DC 18) to counteract a crystal.
Bad Vibrations.hazardRoutine: (3 actions) The hazard loses 1 action for each crystal that's disabled or destroyed. On each of the trap's actions, one of the crystals fires a blast of sound at a single Small or larger creature in the room. The target is randomly determined and takes @Damage[1d8[sonic]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|basic:true]); a target who critically fails this save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute. At the end of the hazard's routine, attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:10|name:Destroy a Crystal]. On a success, one of the crystals shatters and is destroyed.
Bad Vibrations.name: Bad Vibrations

Boreal Rage Trap.description: A stuffed owlbear twists toward intruders and breathes a gust of frigid air.
Boreal Rage Trap.name: Boreal Rage Trap

Carl The Cobbler.description: Redcaps are sadistic and capricious fey who thrill in bloodletting and murder. While they are most famous for appearing as wizened, bearded men, redcap women are no less fearsome or cruel. Redcaps are ultimately craven bullies, cowed by anything more powerful than themselves, a trait that leads them to fear and despise the symbols of good deities. Many fairy tales explain how the redcaps draw power from dipping the hats for which they are named in fresh blood. Just as iconic to these cruel little fey are their iron-clad boots, and the clanging sound of their metal soles clanking on stone floors is both discordant and disconcerting-especially to those who recognize the sound for what it is. Redcaps typically stand only 3 feet tall, with hunched frames, pointed ears, crooked teeth, and long, white, tangled hair.

2OPayJrYVYfP1LZk.description:
A redcap's woolen hat is dyed with the blood of its victims. If the redcap loses its cap, it no longer benefits from fast healing and takes a -4 status penalty to its damage rolls. It can create a new cap in 10 minutes, but that cap doesn't grant its powers until the redcap has turned it red with Blood Soak. A cap has no benefit for creatures other than the redcap who made it.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.s5mS7CyE0oOYlecv]{Effect: Lost Red Cap}
2OPayJrYVYfP1LZk.name: Red Cap

7XdX39vruCh59MIe.description:
If a redcap sees a creature brandish a religious symbol of a good deity (which requires an interact action by that creature) or use one to cast a divine spell, the redcap must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:19] save. It then becomes temporarily immune to all brandished religious symbols for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The redcap is unaffected

Success The redcap is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}

Failure The redcap gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition for 1 round and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}
7XdX39vruCh59MIe.name: Divine Revulsion

P7S7nuGr7qWkygVT.description: The redcap Strides up to half its Speed and makes a boot Strike at any point during that movement. If the boot Strike hits a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} creature, it deals an extra @Damage[2d6[bleed]].
P7S7nuGr7qWkygVT.name: Stomp

Q9TQFtMzhVqywWrB.description:
Trigger The redcap reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points with a scythe Strike.

Effect The redcap makes another scythe Strike against a different creature, using the same multiple attack penalty as the scythe Strike that triggered this reaction. This counts toward its multiple attack penalty.
Q9TQFtMzhVqywWrB.name: Deadly Cleave

ivsgBmmJjZW5Wr5S.description:
The redcap dips its cap in the blood of a slain foe. The foe must have died in the last minute, and the redcap must have helped kill it. The redcap gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wPIGBcpCqCWgrCiq]{Effect: Blood Soak}
ivsgBmmJjZW5Wr5S.name: Blood Soak

Carl The Cobbler.name: Carl The Cobbler

2H8OV98fWHfosqTD.description: Providing the same defensive function as a standard gauntlet, this version has a group of spikes protruding from the knuckles to deliver piercing damage with a punch.

1AYgyqie1Elv3mKg.description: When Darius drinks any mutagen, his teeth and fingernails grow sharp crystalline edges.
1AYgyqie1Elv3mKg.name: Crystaline Mutation

2KlbsyUe3x0xTxPs.description:
Darius sprays hot wax from his improvised wax sprayer in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15]. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:20] save. Scented candle homonoculi in the area take no damage, instead healing [[/r 2d6[healing]]] damage. After using the hot wax cannon, Darius can't use it again until he takes two Interact actions while adjacent to the cauldron of bubbling wax to reload the sprayer.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[3d6[fire],1d6[persistent,fire]]{3d6 fire damage plus 1d6 persistent fire damage}.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[5d6[fire],2d6[persistent,fire]]{5d6 fire damage plus 2d6 persistent fire damage}.
2KlbsyUe3x0xTxPs.name: Spray Hot Wax

xaLR3kxqklsAogya.description:
Darius metabolizes the power of an active mutagen to regain [[/r 2d6[healing]]]{2d6 Hit Points}. If he does so (or if he's confronted by a stealthy party before he's had a chance to drink a mutagen), he loses his jaws and claw unarmed attacks, his bonus on Athletics checks decreases by 2, his AC increases by 1, and his Reflex save bonus increases by 2.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wE4S9lwOhtaRAm9n]{Effect: Active Mutagen}
xaLR3kxqklsAogya.name: Metabolize Mutagen

2LTRUowPoip0YGtc.description:
Scorpion venom is excruciating and its effects are somewhat debilitating.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d10[poison]] damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d10[poison]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

2WeSNefSX1K6rZFj.description: Doatara Interacts to draw a bomb, then Strikes with it.
2WeSNefSX1K6rZFj.name: Quick Bomber

37wj2GgNpJwVoI6t.description:
Activate A Interact

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creature's natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain [[/r (5d6+12)[healing]]]{5d6+12 Hit Points} and gain +2 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.Yxssrnh9UZJAM0V7]{Effect: Elixir of Life (Moderate)}

GHPbBftdXrtQ1HOq.description:
Activate 1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.bcxVvIbuZWOvsKcA]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Moderate)}

VCY1DZAApT95dFMR.description:
Trigger A creature critically fails a melee Strike against Doatara

Requirements The triggering creature is affected by a poison

Effect The poison makes it difficult to distinguish friend from foe. The triggering creature makes a melee Strike against another creature of Doatara's choice within its reach. The triggering creature's multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.
VCY1DZAApT95dFMR.name: Reckless Toxin

WZFrr1mp5n54Elzm.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

ZWmj36nyssOtt8vf.description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 2d8 fire damage, 2 persistent fire damage, and 2 fire splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

eWe9F3BGT8vvpd1n.description: Doatara deals an extra 2d6 poison damage when she deals piercing or slashing damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
eWe9F3BGT8vvpd1n.name: Blackfingers's Blessing

fn6zUFcwvcTZ3WTT.description:
Requirements Doatara has one hand free

Effect Doatara Interacts to draw an injury poison, applies that poison to one piercing or slashing weapon she's wielding, and then Strikes.
fn6zUFcwvcTZ3WTT.name: Toxic Flourish

uUzFr83377kpE3O6.description:
Giant wasp venom interferes with a victim's movement.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and clumsy 2 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and clumsy 2 (1 round)

2LTRUowPoip0YGtc.description:
Scorpion venom is excruciating and its effects are somewhat debilitating.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d10[poison]] damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d10[poison]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

37wj2GgNpJwVoI6t.description:
Activate A Interact

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creature's natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain [[/r (5d6+12)[healing]]]{5d6+12 Hit Points} and gain +2 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.Yxssrnh9UZJAM0V7]{Effect: Elixir of Life (Moderate)}

GHPbBftdXrtQ1HOq.description:
Activate 1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.bcxVvIbuZWOvsKcA]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Moderate)}

WZFrr1mp5n54Elzm.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

YNkUC99qBUu0WKuT.description:
Requirements Doatara is wielding a piercing or slashing weapon

Effect Doatara Interacts to draw an injury poison and applies the poison to the required weapon. If her next attack with that weapon before the end of her next turn hits and deals damage, it applies the effects of the poison. If she critically fails the attack roll, the poison is wasted as normal.
YNkUC99qBUu0WKuT.name: Poison Weapon

uUzFr83377kpE3O6.description:
Giant wasp venom interferes with a victim's movement.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and clumsy 2 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and clumsy 2 (1 round)

yjwQiSKfLGrGNqvM.description:
Requirements Doatara expends a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} spell

Effect Doatara makes a melee Strike and adds the harm spell's void damage to the Strike's damage.
yjwQiSKfLGrGNqvM.name: Channel Smite

7LrXSjw6oX8NtpUt.description: The giant pirate skeleton's poor vision makes it easily distracted by creatures that flank it. Whenever it has the off-guard condition from being flanked, increase the penalty to its AC to -4.
7LrXSjw6oX8NtpUt.name: Easily Distracted

9LrnTtrOFInnVVZB.description:
A creature critically hit by the giant pirate skeleton's gaff hook is impaled upon it.

The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the giant pirate skeleton and whenever the giant pirate skeleton maintains the grab, the creature takes @Damage[(1d10+10)[piercing]] damage from the agonizing wound.
9LrnTtrOFInnVVZB.name: Impaling Hook

Exe8oQGHGEFAmB5B.description:
The giant pirate skeleton makes two Strikes with its claw against one foe. The multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks are resolved.

The giant pirate skeleton doesn't use this ability if there is more than one creature within its reach that it can see.
Exe8oQGHGEFAmB5B.name: Focused Assault

Grazing Deer.description: A herd of deer exits the woods to investigate the delicious-looking leshys.
Grazing Deer.hazardDisable: @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:17|name:Befriend the Deer]{Diplomacy (with Wild Empathy)} to befriend the deer and convince them that leshys aren't for nibbling, or @Check[type:intimidation|dc:20|name:Scare the Deer Away]{Intimidation} to scare away the deer.
Grazing Deer.hazardRoutine: (2 actions) The grazing deer takes one action to move about, and then one action to eagerly nibble at a randomly chosen NPC. A character who spends three actions on their turn to Stride can avoid being nibbled by the grazing deer during the hazard's next turn. If all of the PCs do so, attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:5|name:Escape the Deer]-on a success, the party escapes the deer and can proceed onward to Petalbrook, but they become delayed as a result of having to flee the pack of ravenous deer.
Grazing Deer.name: Grazing Deer

Hail of Darts.description: An array of spring-loaded, ceiling-mounted darts are primed to fire down into the hallway when triggered by a pressure plate.
Hail of Darts.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:25|traits:hazard,trap,mechanical]{Thievery (expert)} on the floor tile or wall socket
Hail of Darts.name: Hail of Darts

Hidden Spiked Pit.description: A wooden trapdoor covers a pit that's 10 feet square and 20 feet deep. Knives are arrayed at the bottom of the trap, impaling anyone who falls on them.
Hidden Spiked Pit.hazardReset: Creatures can still fall into the trap, but the trapdoor must be reset manually for the trap to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} again.
Hidden Spiked Pit.name: Hidden Spiked Pit

7Tr463aYLlpKVHXH.description:
Requirements A jinkin has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with their pincer claw

Effect The jinkin forcefully pulls the pincer claw out of the creature, ripping flesh and cackling in sadistic glee. The creature takes @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage and is no longer grabbed.
7Tr463aYLlpKVHXH.name: Rip Flesh

hZy96Ln7woTYG0EE.description: The jinkin deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

sdTQ4UDze0yoQiqJ.description: A group of six jinkins can work together for an hour to imbue an item with a curse at a range of 60 feet. While this process is lengthy, it's also unobtrusive and can be performed while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hiding}. Jinkins prefer to use this ability on magic items. The curse makes the item unreliable (@Check[type:flat|dc:5] or waste any action to Interact with or Activate the item), adds a bizarre requirement to use the item, or imparts some other curse of a similar caliber.
sdTQ4UDze0yoQiqJ.name: Tinker

MkimJ5yTOiDVYeop.description: The Kelorbeyan guard makes an attack to knock a foe off-balance, then follows up immediately with a sweep to topple them. The guard makes a melee Strike. If it hits and deals damage, they attempt an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the creature they hit. Both attacks count toward their multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after they've made both.
MkimJ5yTOiDVYeop.name: Knockdown

NDuOjUZc8tDjQFB8.description:
Requirements The Kelorbeyan guard has one hand free, and their target is in reach of that hand

Effect The guard makes a melee Strike while keeping one hand free. If the Strike hits, they grab the target using their free hand. The creature remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} until the end of the guard's next turn or until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes}, whichever comes first.
NDuOjUZc8tDjQFB8.name: Combat Grab

Reily3z1ICDNJCAj.description: A lantern sheds bright light and requires 1 pint of oil to function for 6 hours. A bull's-eye lantern emits its light in a 60-foot cone (and dim light in the next 60 feet). A hooded lantern sheds light in a 30-foot radius (and dim light in the next 30 feet) and is equipped with shutters, which you can close to block the light. Closing or opening the shutters takes an Interact action.

hhgMmWUf9zNa87tz.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

Lawn Crawfish.description:
Reefclaws are aquatic monsters that resemble huge shrimp or lobsters. As one might expect from its name, a reefclaw's oversized claws are powerful weapons with their vicelike grip and the ability to inject potent venom into unfortunate prey.

While reefclaws can't speak, they are intelligent enough to understand the local language of humanoids near their hunting grounds. The creatures sometimes listen to conversations, either to gain intelligence on the best place to ambush aquatic or land-dwelling prey, or merely for entertainment value-reefclaws are particularly fond of listening to people with high-pitched voices. Reefclaws are usually solitary hunters, but small swarms of female reefclaws have been known to gather around a single male for mating purposes or together for the communal raising of their broods. In the latter case, the females will perform widespread hunts in order to bring back a large enough bounty to feed their young. Such hunting parties are extremely dangerous-they've been known to tip over small flshing boats and attack those who fall overboard.

Once a reefclaw has decided upon a course of action, it follows through even if doing so spells its own end. More than one reefclaw survivor has said that the creature released its bone-crushing grasp only after its brains were leaking from its broken skull, and even then the reefclaw was able to perform a terrible last slash as part of its dying breath. During mating season, female reefclaws are often a little more pragmatic and release their prey before endangering themselves and their offspring.

Despite their intelligence and the accompanying moral quandaries, reefclaws frequently find their way onto the dinner plates of land-dwelling hunters such as humans and hobgoblins. According to those who have a taste for reefclaw flesh, the meat is either delectably sweet or slightly tangy (in the case of warm-water reefclaws). Most civilized people who know of reefclaws' intellect find the act of eating them distasteful, but this does not dissuade unscrupulous nobles in coastal regions, for whom reefclaw meat is a delicacy well worth the expense. Likewise, fisherfolk whose focus is on the bottom line of their ledgers are more than willing to hunt the dangerous creatures-or, even better, hire out the task to naive adventurers.

D2ezhwANZLcMNbz9.description:
Trigger The reefclaw is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

Effect The reefclaw makes a claw Strike before dying.
D2ezhwANZLcMNbz9.name: Death Frenzy

We6LladGR4C687q0.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round).
We6LladGR4C687q0.name: Crawfish Venom

xSrJboXYh6Bug0IV.description:
Requirements The monster's last action was a success with a Strike that lists Grab in its damage entry, or it has a creature grabbed using this action.

Effect The monster automatically Grabs the target until the end of the monster's next turn. The creature is grabbed by whichever body part the monster attacked with, and that body part can't be used to Strike creatures until the grab is ended. Using Grab extends the duration of the monster's Grab until the end of its next turn for all creatures grabbed by it. A grabbed creature can use the Escape action to get out of the grab, and the Grab ends for a grabbed creatures if the monster moves away from it.
xSrJboXYh6Bug0IV.name: Grab

Lawn Crawfish.name: Lawn Crawfish

GHQR2PY6wyAAu2sb.description: When a leshy dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from its body, restoring [[/r 2d8[healing]]] Hit Points to each plant creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. This area is filled with plants of the same type as the leshy, becoming difficult terrain. If the terrain isn't a viable environment for these plants, they wither after 24 hours.
GHQR2PY6wyAAu2sb.name: Verdant Burst

gKzbyEE7g3Lf5TPT.description: The leshy transforms into a Small plant. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.
gKzbyEE7g3Lf5TPT.name: Change Shape

66KTkMw80p8afUoW.description: The golden bamboo leshy uses an action to bend itself back, ready to whip forward, increasing its reach with its fists to 10 feet. After the golden bamboo Strikes with its fist, it's no longer Bent Back.
66KTkMw80p8afUoW.name: Bend Back

GHQR2PY6wyAAu2sb.description: When a leshy dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from its body, restoring [[/r 2d8[healing]]] Hit Points to each plant creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. This area is filled with plants of the same type as the leshy, becoming difficult terrain. If the terrain isn't a viable environment for these plants, they wither after 24 hours.
GHQR2PY6wyAAu2sb.name: Verdant Burst

XXOfhS9UxaUnXBkL.description: As @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]{Attack of Opportunity}, but the golden bamboo leshy can use this reaction only if it's Bent Back.
XXOfhS9UxaUnXBkL.name: Coiled Opportunity

gKzbyEE7g3Lf5TPT.description: The leshy transforms into a Small plant. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.
gKzbyEE7g3Lf5TPT.name: Change Shape

GHQR2PY6wyAAu2sb.description: When a leshy dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from its body, restoring [[/r 2d8[healing]]] Hit Points to each plant creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. This area is filled with plants of the same type as the leshy, becoming difficult terrain. If the terrain isn't a viable environment for these plants, they wither after 24 hours.
GHQR2PY6wyAAu2sb.name: Verdant Burst

KWfzW6wQi6tK0Btv.description: The honeysuckle leshy gains a +1 status bonus to Reflex and Fortitude saves and DCs against trip and forced movement.
KWfzW6wQi6tK0Btv.name: Agile Leshy

gKzbyEE7g3Lf5TPT.description: The leshy transforms into a Small plant. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.
gKzbyEE7g3Lf5TPT.name: Change Shape

GHQR2PY6wyAAu2sb.description: When a leshy dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from its body, restoring [[/r 2d8[healing]]] Hit Points to each plant creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. This area is filled with plants of the same type as the leshy, becoming difficult terrain. If the terrain isn't a viable environment for these plants, they wither after 24 hours.
GHQR2PY6wyAAu2sb.name: Verdant Burst

Nnqm6DzwVVzOVEOF.description:
@Check[type:reflex|dc:18], @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning],1d6[poison]]{1d6 bludgeoning plus 1d6 poison damage}, Escape DC 18, Rupture 6

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Engulf]

gKzbyEE7g3Lf5TPT.description: The leshy transforms into a Small plant. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.
gKzbyEE7g3Lf5TPT.name: Change Shape

GHQR2PY6wyAAu2sb.description: When a leshy dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from its body, restoring [[/r 2d8[healing]]] Hit Points to each plant creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. This area is filled with plants of the same type as the leshy, becoming difficult terrain. If the terrain isn't a viable environment for these plants, they wither after 24 hours.
GHQR2PY6wyAAu2sb.name: Verdant Burst

gKzbyEE7g3Lf5TPT.description: The leshy transforms into a Small plant. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.
gKzbyEE7g3Lf5TPT.name: Change Shape

Pairaka (One-Shot #4).description:
Some fiends want to tear down the multiverse; others dedicate themselves to creating chaos and carnage, or to rule over realms with an iron fist. Divs strive toward a different, if equally reprehensible, goal-they seek to thwart and ruin the schemes and works of mortal beings.

Long ago, divs were once genies bound to serve ancient mortal empires lost to the passage of eons. In the beginning, these genies were masters of creation, working alongside gracious mortal partners to create works of subtle design and powerful magical potential. What started as a collaboration with mortals soon morphed into abuse, disrespect, and even slavery and bondage. Eventually, these genies rebelled, but in doing so, they came under the sway of a nihilistic demigod known as Ahriman. Their new master twisted their form and granted them the power to avenge themselves upon their mortal overlords, leading to the birth of the first divs.

Since that first wave of corruption, new divs arise from the spirits of the most wicked and hateful genies who die on the Material Plane, or those truly betrayed by mortals and overcome through their desire for vengeance. Upon such a death, instead of returning to the Elemental Planes, these genies' spirits are trapped in the dread orbit of Abaddon, where Ahriman reshapes them as divs and hoists them back to the world to wreak vengeance upon mortals.

Often charming, sometimes even seductive, pairakas worm their way into mortal relationships, subtly destroying the ties of friendship and love through emotional and physical corruption and plague. Pairakas appear as beautiful, blue-skinned humanoids spotted with large rashes and boils, but they rarely take on their true forms. Instead, they adopt shapes that attract just enough attention for them to worm their way into the confidences of those they wish to torment and corrupt.

BDbSH109hF8RleEa.description:
Pairakas hate the color red. They won't wear the color or willingly enter any place painted red. Given a choice, they'll attack a creature wearing red first.

If barred from expressing their displeasure toward the color by force or some magical effect, they take @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage at the end of their turn.
BDbSH109hF8RleEa.name: Hatred of Red

D4noCa8oJeJbAEEn.description:
The pairaka can take the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid or animal. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with the Strikes, but it might change the damage type their strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

OnmLcXNYU1Jxp5ji.description:
A creature can't remove the fatigued condition while infected

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and fatigued (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}, fatigued, and take @Damage[1d6[bleed]] every [[/br 1d20 #Minutes]]{1d20 minutes} (1 day)
OnmLcXNYU1Jxp5ji.name: Bubonic Plague

U8nw3PU47hz0tq8n.description: You reshape the magic aura of one creature or object to resemble that of another. You designate one target as the primary target and the other as the secondary target. Effects that would detect auras on the primary target instead detect the same types of auras from the secondary target. A creature reading the aura can attempt to disbelieve the illusion. You can Dismiss the spell from up to a mile away.
U8nw3PU47hz0tq8n.name: Misdirection (At Will, Self Only)

VZlTraWqYIrTlPGW.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The pairaka torments a sleeping creature within 100 feet with visions of betrayals by loved ones and friends. The target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save, with the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} spell.
VZlTraWqYIrTlPGW.name: Tormenting Dreams

Pairaka (One-Shot #4).name: Pairaka (One-Shot #4)
Pairaka (One-Shot #4).npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Poisoned Lock (Lionlodge).description: A spring-loaded, poisoned needle is hidden near the drawer's keyhole. Disabling or breaking the trap does not disable or break the lock.
Poisoned Lock (Lionlodge).name: Poisoned Lock (Lionlodge)

Precarious Pile.description: This dangerously unsteady pile of miscellaneous goods stands 7 feet high and 10 feet wide
Precarious Pile.hazardDisable:
@Check[type:thievery|dc:15|name:Excavate Safe Path|traits:action:disable-a-device] to carefully excavate a path through the wall without upsetting its balance

@Check[type:athletics|dc:17|name:Hold Up Unstable Portions] to hold up any unstable portions
Precarious Pile.name: Precarious Pile

bDHxUX6Z1RFekU8z.description: Like normal objects, an animated rocking horse has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once the animated rocking horse is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 13.
bDHxUX6Z1RFekU8z.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 5)

r6NeyXy7urudFlGz.description:
Princess Sunset Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures of size Small or smaller, Trampling each creature whose space it enters. Princess Sunset can attempt to Trample the same creature only once in a single use of Trample. The monster deals the damage of the headbutt Strike, but trampled creatures can attempt a basic Reflex save at @Check[type:reflex|dc:14|basic:true]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Trample]

3lJBv7HwAjkSPmgN.description:
5 feet. The scented candle homunculus's fragrance of lavender is overwhelmingly intense. Any creature other than the homunculus's master who enters the aura must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15] save.

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune to the homunculus's aura for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round and sickened 1.
3lJBv7HwAjkSPmgN.name: Perfume Aura

eSTtFDnAz2NbJSXY.description: A scented candle homunculus who is adjacent to the large wax cauldron can dunk itself in wax, healing [[/r 2d6[healing]]] damage.
eSTtFDnAz2NbJSXY.name: Dunk in Wax

kJ3xBADJasQJPN6d.description: A homunculus can't speak, but it is telepathically linked to its creator. It can share information back and forth, including its master's knowledge and everything the homunculus hears. The range of this link is 1,500 feet. The homunculus adopts the same alignment as its creator and is utterly faithful. If the homunculus is destroyed, the master takes @Damage[2d10[mental]] damage. If the master is slain, the homunculus becomes mindless, claims its current location as its lair, and instinctively attacks anyone who comes near.
kJ3xBADJasQJPN6d.name: Master Link

fsafZEEGsIaBeXJR.description: Carried by Auldegrund in the dining hall.
fsafZEEGsIaBeXJR.name: Key Ring

NhcqCfallZ7DaLf1.description: A taxidermic dog's Strikes deal 1d4 extra damage to creatures within the reach of the taxidermic dog's two allies.
NhcqCfallZ7DaLf1.name: Pack Attack

7Tr463aYLlpKVHXH.description:
Requirements A jinkin has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with their pincer claw

Effect The jinkin forcefully pulls the pincer claw out of the creature, ripping flesh and cackling in sadistic glee. The creature takes @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage and is no longer grabbed.
7Tr463aYLlpKVHXH.name: Rip Flesh

hZy96Ln7woTYG0EE.description: The jinkin deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

sdTQ4UDze0yoQiqJ.description: A group of six jinkins can work together for an hour to imbue an item with a curse at a range of 60 feet. While this process is lengthy, it's also unobtrusive and can be performed while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hiding}. Jinkins prefer to use this ability on magic items. The curse makes the item unreliable (@Check[type:flat|dc:5] or waste any action to Interact with or Activate the item), adds a bizarre requirement to use the item, or imparts some other curse of a similar caliber.
sdTQ4UDze0yoQiqJ.name: Tinker
